sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"宣布，公开"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: announce, declare, proclaim, pronounce, advertise, broadcast, publish
means: announce ：多指首次宣布大家感兴趣或可满足大家好奇心的事情。
declare ：侧重正式就某事清楚明白地宣布。
proclaim ：指官方宣布重大事件或施政方针，语体比announce正式。
pronounce ：词义与announce, declare接近，但较多用于指法律判决方面的宣布。
advertise ：指通过文字和图像资料等的反复宣传而引起公众的注意，有时隐含令人不快或言过其实的意味。
broadcast ：专指利用广播或电视传播消息或发表见解。
publish ：专指通过报刊或其它媒介向公众公布事情。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"发行，发出，发给"之意。
means: issue ： 多指通过官方或正式渠道正式发行。
distribute ： 指把东西分发给所属者或应得者。
publish ： 普通用词，多指出版发行文字作品，也指发布新闻或发表见解等。

sentence.Network_en: My object was to publish a scholarly work on Peter Mourne.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的目标是出版一本关于彼得·莫恩的学术著作。

sentence.Network_en: To write and publish this poem was a daring, transgressive act.
sentence.Network_cn: 创作并发表这首诗是一个大胆越轨的举动。

sentence.Network_en: The deadline to publish the document is a week tomorrow.
sentence.Network_cn: 一周后的明天是公布这份文件的最后期限。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 发布 (PUBLISH)：Andy 通过向 Presence Server 发送 PUBLISH 请求提供其在线状态信息。Presence Server 将 Andy 的在线状态信 …
字典中揭字的解释 ... (4) 肩负;担;扛[ carry] (6) 披露;发表;公布[ announce; publish; disclose] (8) 掀起; 拿开[ take off].
发字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 发信〖 postaletter〗 发行〖 issue;publish;distribute〗 发硎〖 sharp〗.
英语词汇的奥秘 ... vanish 消逝 publish 公布 finish 结束.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'make generally known'): from the stem of Old French puplier, from Latin publicare 'make public', from publicus (see public)

entry.def: When a company publishes a book or magazine, it prints copies of it, which are sent to shops to be sold.

example.ex: His latest book of poetry will be published by Faber in May.
example.tran: 他的最新诗集将由菲贝尔出版公司于5月出版。

entry.def: When the people in charge of a newspaper or magazine publish a piece of writing or a photograph, they print it in their newspaper or magazine.

example.ex: The ban was imposed after the magazine published an article satirising the government...
example.tran: 这家杂志刊登了一篇讽刺政府的文章后被停刊。

example.ex: I don't encourage people to take photographs like this without permission, but by law we can publish.
example.tran: 我不鼓励人们未经允许就拍摄这样的照片，但根据法律我们可以刊登。

entry.def: If someone publishes a book or an article that they have written, they arrange to have it published.

example.ex: John Lennon found time to publish two books of his humorous prose.
example.tran: 约翰·列侬抽时间出版了两本幽默散文。

entry.def: If you publish information or an opinion, you make it known to the public by having it printed in a newspaper, magazine, or official document.

example.ex: The demonstrators called on the government to publish a list of registered voters.
example.tran: 游行者呼吁政府公布注册选民的名单。

sentences.sentence: "The newspaper published the news of the royal couple's divorce"

means.word_mean: 2. prepare and issue for public distribution or sale;
3. have (one's written work) issued for publication;

sentences.sentence: "How many books did Georges Simenon write?"
"She published 25 books during her long career"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 公共的,公用的;公开的,公然的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 出版物;出版,发行;公布,发表
stems_affixes.word_buile: public公共的+ation表名词→n.出版物;出版,发行;公布,发表
public公开的+ity表名词→n.公开,宣传,广告,推销
re+publ人民+ic→n.共和国, 共和政体 adj.共和的
publ人民+ish表动词→进入人民中→出版

Sentence.sentence: Perhaps it will become the mark of an author to reckon with that he or she is still published in hard copy.
Authors still published in printed versions will be considered important ones

Researchers in Canada just published a study in the journal Psychological Science that says trying to get people to think more positively can actually have the opposite effect: it can simply highlight how unhappy they are.
In a paper published recently, Kapur applied the principle of productive failure to mathematical problem solving in three schools.
She was also a poet and the first African-American ever to publish a book.
She was the first African-American slave to publish a book

sentences.en: The only daily newspaper in the city did not publish yesterday because of a strike.
sentences.cn: 昨天市内惟一的日报因罢工而没出版。

sentences.en: She has recently published her fourth book with the Commercial Press.
sentences.cn: 她最近在商务印书馆出版了她的第四本专著。

jushi.english: It's a good story,but we can't publish;it would offend many people.
jushi.chinese: 这是个好故事,但我们不能发表,那会得罪很多人。

jushi.english: The only daily newspaper in the city did not publish yesterday because of a strike.
jushi.chinese: 市内唯一的日报昨天因罢工而没发行。

jushi.english: He has been publishing for many authors.
jushi.chinese: 他已出版很多作者的著作。
